channel.title: World at One: BBC Radio 4 News
channel.description: Forty five minutes of news, analysis and comment with Martha Kearney and Shaun Ley
channel.itunes:summary: Forty five minutes of news, analysis and comment with Martha Kearney and Shaun Ley
channel.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Capital shortfall in UK banks
item.description: On the programme today we look at the announcement of new capital requirements for the banking industry. We'll bring analysis of David Miliband's decision to quit British politics for New York, with John Mann MP, Alan Johnston and James Forsyth. A Tory MP slams the new expenses regulator for incompetence and fifty years after the Beeching Report we debate the virtues of closing so many railway lines.
item.itunes:subtitle: On the programme today we look at the announcement of new capital requirements for the banking industry. We'll bring analysis of David Miliband's decision to quit British politics for New York, with John Mann MP, Alan Johnston and James Forsyth. A...

We'll bring analysis of David Miliband's decision to quit British politics for New York, with John Mann MP, Alan Johnston and James Forsyth. A Tory MP slams the new expenses regulator for incompetence and fifty years after the Beeching Report we debate the virtues of closing so many railway lines.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 4

item.title: Response to Stafford Hospital Inquiry
item.description: England's Health Secretary has given the government's response to the Stafford Hospital Inquiry - which revealed huge failings in basic patient care. We get reaction from one of the leading campaigners for change and discuss effect Jeremy Hunt's plans will mean for the NHS. An RAF helicopter has been brought in to supply remote farms in Northern Ireland cut off by the deep snow which fell last week. We hear from one couple who have been unable to leave home for days. Italy's top court has overturned the acquittal of Amanda Knox and her ex-boyfriend Raffaele Sollecito, who were accused of murdering the British student, Meredith Kercher, in 2007. And we hear why descendants of Richard the Third want him buried in York.

item.title: Health Secretary addresses 'health tourism'
item.description: On Wato, the Health Secretary on proposals to curb so called 'health tourism' in the NHS, we hear from a group of teenagers stranded by the snow on the Isle of Arran and as a new exhibition opens at the British Museum, we hear from the classicist Mary Beard on life in Ancient Pompeii.

item.title: WATO: Hours to decide Cyprus' fate
item.description: "Salvation or destruction": the latest on the crisis in Cyprus; a major project tries to unlock the secrets of DNA; how a bracelet on the ankle is helping to keep alcoholic parents from losing their children; and spies, sex and lies, we look back at the Profumo Affair.
